_notes: This file stores column name mappings for different client Excel formats
When auto-detection fails, add client-specific mappings here
Mappings are matched by client_id (you define the ID)
Each mapping overrides the default column detection for that field
Use 'header_row' to specify which row contains headers (1-indexed, Excel style)
Use 'sheet_patterns' to match specific sheet names for this client
_usage: 1. Run the tool once to see what columns were detected
2. If detection fails, add a new client entry with correct mappings
3. The tool will use these mappings for all future files with this client_id
4. You can also use the UI to save mappings automatically

default._comment: Fallback mappings - these extend the built-in detection
default._note_on_date: Generic 'date' column is now mapped to in_service_date as fallback - this is the most common CPA interpretation

_example_client._comment: Example: Client with unusual column names
